alert.note: Alert for Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hard Freeze Warning issued February 24 at 2:03AM PST until February 24 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TONIGHT TO 9 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Hard Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 24 degrees expected Thursday morning. Friday morning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 expected. * WHERE...Central Valley and adjacent foothills below 2,000 feet. * WHEN...For the Hard Freeze Warning, through to 9 AM PST this morning. For the Freeze Warning Friday, 1 AM PST to 9 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This morning will see the coldest temperatures when lows are forecast to drop into the mid 20s to upper 20s for a significant portion of the Central Valley for more than 3 hours. Interact with us via social media www.facebook.com/nws.sacramento www.twitter.com/nwssacramento
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
